docs.title: APIs
docs.text: Term API

docs.title: Term
docs.text: The Term library is used to emulate a terminal.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
local term = require("term")

term.setPos(1, 1)
term.clearLine()
term.write("Hello, World!")

docs.title: write
docs.text:
write( text )

Write a string to the terminal.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: 1. text? : string - Text to write on terminal

docs.title: getPos
docs.text:
getPos()

Get the cursor position.

Coordinates start from 1, 1.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
1. x : integer - X coordinate
  2. y : integer - Y coordinate

docs.title: setPos
docs.text:
setPos( x, y )

Set the cursor position.

Coordinate start from 1,1.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
1. x : number - X coordinate
  2. y : number - Y coordinate

docs.title: getSize
docs.text:
getSize()

Get the size of the terminal.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
1. width : integer - Width of the terminal
  2. height : integer - Height of the terminal

docs.title: setSize
docs.text:
setSize( width, height )

Set the size of the terminal.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
1. width : number - Width of the terminal
  2. height : number - Height of the terminal

docs.title: getForeground
docs.text:
getForeground()

Get the R, G and B values of the current text color.

Values range from 0 to 255.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
1. r : integer - Red value
  2. g : integer - Green value
  3. b : integer - Blue value

docs.title: setForeground
docs.text:
setForeground( r, g, b ) or setForeground( rgb )

Set the text color.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Values range from 0 to 255.

  1. r : integer - Red value
  2. g : integer - Green value
  3. b : integer - Blue value

docs.title: OR
docs.text:
Value is hex color 0xRRGGBB (e.g. 0xff7700).

  1. rgb : integer - Decimal value of RGB combined.

docs.title: getBackground
docs.text:
getBackground()

Get the R, G and B values of the current background color.

Values range from 0 to 255.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
1. r : integer - Red value
  2. g : integer - Green value
  3. b : integer - Blue value

docs.title: setBackground
docs.text:
setBackground( r, g, b ) orsetBackground( rgb )

Set the background color.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
Values range from 0 to 255.

  1. r : integer - Red value
  2. g : integer - Green value
  3. b : integer - Blue value

docs.title: OR
docs.text:
Value is hex color 0xRRGGBB (e.g. 0xff7700).

  1. rgb : integer - Decimal value of RGB combined.

docs.title: clear
docs.text:
clear()

Wipes the terminal and set the background to the current set.

docs.title: clearLine
docs.text:
clearLine()

Like clear() but only clears the horizontal line of the cursor position.

docs.title: scroll
docs.text:
scroll( lines )

Scroll the terminal by n lines.

Lines that go out of bounds are lost.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: 1. lines : integer - Lines to scroll

docs.title: getBlink
docs.text:
getBlink()

Get the status of the cursor blink.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: 1. isBlinking : boolean - Whether it is blinking.

docs.title: setBlink
docs.text:
setBlink( enable )

Set the status of the cursor blink.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: 1. enable : boolean - Whether to blink.

docs.title: toRealPos
docs.text:
toRealPos( x, y )

Convert from terminal coordinates to screen coordinates.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
1. x : number - X coordinate of terminal
  2. y : number - Y coordinate of terminal

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
1. x : integer - X coordinate of screen
  2. y : integer - Y coordinate of screen

docs.title: fromRealPos
docs.text:
fromRealPos( x, y )

Convert from screen coordinates to terminal coordinates.

Use this function to convert mouse event positions relative to terminal

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
1. x : number - X coordinate of screen
  2. y : number - Y coordinate of screen

docs.title: Returns
docs.text:
1. x : integer - X coordinate of terminal
  2. y : integer - Y coordinate of terminal
